channel.title: logPhile@blog:~$ | The Logs Know What Broke First on
channel.description: Recent content in logPhile@blog:~$ | The Logs Know What Broke First on

item.title: Directory Drift: Auditing Incomplete Entra User Profiles with PowerShell + Graph
item.author: phil@logphile.com (Phil Boyce)
item.description: Missing user metadata can break your policies, groups, and reports. Learn how to audit Entra ID user profiles using PowerShell and Microsoft Graph.

item.title: X-Men Colors in the Windows Terminal
item.author: phil@logphile.com (Phil Boyce)
item.description: Channel Jim Lee’s 90s X-Men in your Windows Terminal without the comic book store smell. A simple tweak that makes terminal life a little less painful.

item.title: Faking an Org Chart in Entra: Mapping Hierarchies with PowerShell + Graph
item.author: phil@logphile.com (Phil Boyce)
item.description: What if your org chart wasn’t buried in HR PDFs but lived where access decisions are made? Use Microsoft Graph to recursively trace Entra ID hierarchies.

item.title: Az vs Graph: What PowerShell Module to Use (and When)
item.author: phil@logphile.com (Phil Boyce)
item.description: Azure has two major PowerShell modules: Az and Microsoft.Graph. Learn when to use each, why it matters, and how they overlap.

item.title: Ditch the Portal: Create Entra Users with PowerShell + Graph
item.author: phil@logphile.com (Phil Boyce)
item.description: Ditch the portal and script like a pro—this post shows you how to create Entra ID users with PowerShell and Microsoft Graph for smarter, faster, mistake-free identity management.
